snippet: Firefighters and emergency personnel on Thursday dug deeply into the wreckage, looking for survivors and possible evidence of what caused the blast.
abstract: Firefighters and emergency personnel dig deeply into the wreckage of two buildings in East Harlem leveled in a powerful explosion, looking for survivors; search by Con Edison workers for cause of a gas leak, which a preliminary investigation indicates touched off the collapse, continues; death toll rises to eight.

byline.original: By MARC SANTORA and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Patrick McGeehan, Kate Pastor, Eli M. Rosenberg, Michael Schwirtz, Nate Schweber, Kate Taylor and Julie Turkewitz.

lead_paragraph: Firefighters and emergency personnel on Thursday dug deeply into the wreckage, looking for survivors and possible evidence of what caused the blast.

headline.main: As Crews Search for Survivors, They Discover Only More Victims
headline.print_headline: As Crews Search for Survivors, They Discover Only More Victims
